buildup.text: Garamond was one of the first typefaces designed for print rather than mimicking handwriting.

discovery.text: Its elegant proportions, low contrast, and open counters make it supremely readable in long texts.

twist.text: A 2014 study claimed switching US government documents to Garamond would save $136 million in ink yearly.
